message.content: This question requires knowledge about the concept of camouflage. Camouflage is when an organism blends in with its surroundings to avoid being seen by predators or prey. Option (B) is the correct answer because a lizard appearing like the dead things that fall from trees in the fall would allow it to blend in with its environment. Option (A) is incorrect because a polar bear on a sand dune would not be able to camouflage due to its contrasting colors. Option (C) is incorrect because a white frog would be easily visible in its environment. Option (D) is incorrect because a garter snake on a white driveway would also be easily visible.

This question requires knowledge about camouflage and how it helps organisms blend into their environment. Option (B) is the correct answer because it describes a lizard appearing like the dead things that fall from trees in the fall. This means that the lizard has adapted its appearance to resemble the environment around it, helping it hide from potential predators. Option (A) is incorrect because a polar bear on a sand dune would not be camouflaged due to its stark color contrast. Option (C) is incorrect because a white frog would not be well camouflaged in most environments. Option (D) is incorrect because a garter snake on a white driveway would also not be well camouflaged.

Camouflage refers to the ability of an organism to blend in with its surroundings, making it harder for predators or prey to spot it. In this question, option (B) is the correct answer because a lizard that appears like the dead things falling from trees in the fall would be camouflaging itself to match its environment. Option (A) is incorrect because a polar bear on a sand dune would not be well camouflaged. Option (C) is incorrect because a frog that is all white may stand out in most environments. Option (D) is incorrect because a garter snake on a white driveway would also not be well camouflaged.
